definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: I got only a fleeting glimpse of them.
sentences.chinese: 我只惊鸿一瞥地看到他们。

sentences.english: It is surely a little pity. Beauty is always sparkled and then vanished.
sentences.chinese: 有点遗憾，美丽总是那么惊鸿一瞥。

sentences.english: Hundreds of enthusiasts wearing goggles catch a glimpse of the phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 数百位热情人士戴著护目镜捕捉日食现象的惊鸿一瞥。

definition: Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 qu1] or 霓裳羽衣舞[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 wu3]
nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
limpid autumn waters (trad. description of girl's beautiful eyes)
(literary) the vast sky/(finance) eventual downturn/poor prospects in the long term
(literary) (of a woman) to have a graceful demeanor/beautiful woman
to float in the air/swiftly/nimbly/easy and relaxed
spry and lively (of dancing and movements)
